title: Brane cosmology with a bulk scalar field
abstract: We consider ``cosmologically symmetric'' (i.e. solutions with homogeneity and isotropy along three spatial dimensions) five-dimensional spacetimes with a scalar field and a three-brane representing our universe. We write Einstein's equations in a conformal gauge, using light-cone coordinates. We obtain explicit solutions: a. assuming proportionality between the scalar field and the logarithm of the (bulk) scale factor; b. assuming separable solutions. We then discuss the cosmology in the brane nduced by these solutions.
